abstract: Big banks in Britain, Germany and France could gain an edge as their Wall Street counterparts move out of derivatives, proprietary trading and hedge funds, a report says.
snippet: Big banks in Britain, Germany and France could gain an edge as their Wall Street counterparts move out of derivatives, proprietary trading and hedge funds, a report says.
lead_paragraph: New financial regulations emerging from Washington could increase the bottom lines of some banks — just not banks on Wall Street.

headline.main: JPMorgan Says Dodd-Frank Favors Europe’s Banks

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)
